Featured Events















David Sedaris
Conversation, Art, Arts, Entertainment, Culture, Community
David Sedaris’ sardonic wit and incisive social critiques make him one of America’s preeminent humor writers. Likened to a modern-day Mark Twain, Sedaris is noted for his ability to draw humorous, touching, and universal observations about human nature from his own, often quirky, experiences. A former National Public Radio host, he is a best-selling author with titles including Me Talk Pretty O...

How to Pitch & Deal With Q&A
Academics, Campus Connections, Business, Community, First Gen, Entrepreneurship, Networking, New Venture Competition, Career
Topic: How to Pitch & Deal With Q&A

WORKSHOP OVERVIEW

Join us for the eighth and final workshop of the series! Teams competing in the final round of the New Venture Competition are required to pitch to judges on May 12th. Teams will give a 10-minute presentation followed by a 10-minute Q&A session. Learn more about what is expected and how to succeed.

2023 Community Lecture Series | Cataracts

Join us for our free seminars where you will learn about the causes, symptoms, and treatment of eye-related conditions. 

All seminars are one hour and begin at 7 p.m. PT.

Cataracts | May 2 - When do I need cataract surgery and what are the latest updates in cataract surgery technology?

Speakers:

Structural and Social Drivers of Health and Cancer Health Disparities Research
Diversity, Science, Cancer Research
Lecture in Honor of Asian American, Native Hawaiian, and Pacific Islander (AANHPI) Heritage Month

Abstract: We are increasingly aware of the impact of structural and social determinants as fundamental drivers of health inequities, but how do we design and implement population-level studies to investigate the role of these factors? Improv Revolution presents  The Coup de Comedy 2023  & Global Improvisation Initiative Exploration: Evolution of Improvisation 
Comedy
The Coup de Comedy is a FREE four-day comedy festival consisting of panels, workshops, and performances, available to the community. The Coup de Comedy 2023 will feature many of our free events at UCI and some offerings online. This year we will also be partnering with the Global Improvisation Initiative (GII) again to explore the Evolution of Improvisation up until now as well as present innov...

Navigating: Customer Discovery and Business Model Feasibility
Entrepreneurship, Business, Startup
Embark on a journey of business validation with our "Navigating" workshop, designed to guide student entrepreneurs through the critical process of customer discovery and assessing business model feasibility. In this comprehensive and interactive session, you'll gain practical insights into identifying and achieving pre-product market fit, product market fit, and sustaining success post product ...

Free GMAT Test Strategy Workshop
Academics, Education, General Public, Graduate School Prep, Resources
Our free GMAT strategy workshop offers you an introduction to the exam and provides valuable tips and tricks for studying. The workshop focuses on test mechanics, including test administration and scoring, and provide you with ideas about preparing for the exam, either on your own or through a prep course like ours.

International Film Club: Bubble (2005)
Film, Film Production, Film Screening, Filmmaking
Actor and Comedian John Early and Professor Catherine Liu present Bubble (2005) for the UCI International Film Club, followed by Q&A.

Bubble is a 2005 American drama film directed by Steven Soderbergh about three low-paid doll factory workers, one of whom is murdered. Soderbergh also shot and edited the film under the pseudonyms Peter Andrews and Mary Ann Bernard, taken from his father's giv...

Music of the Knights

Commemorating the majestic musical masterpieces of Sir Andrew Lloyd Webber, Sir Elton John, and Sir Paul McCartney
